ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] RE: Gordon
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh, I ve got a strong cleric, a dexterous rogue (the worst of my mistakes - or maybe it s just that nothing helps a rogue), and a charismatic shaman.  I used
ygData.messageBody:
Heh, I've got a strong cleric, a dexterous rogue (the worst of my mistakes -
or maybe it's just that nothing helps a rogue), and a charismatic shaman. I
used to have a really brawny Erudite wizard too.

But then I was talking to someone not too long ago who got their character
to level 19 before realizing what bonus points were and that he hadn't used
them at all. So I guess I could be worse off.

Peace
Evulia, brawny bard of 11 verses, Tunare


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Sylly Songsynger [mailto:jgs@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 01, 2000 12:57 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] RE: Gordon
>
>
> Heh,
>
> Ok. ok, I'll fess up. I went back to some of my very first
> characters -
> ones I dropped only after a few weeks or in some cases a few hours of
> playing. When I looked at their stats, I did a OMG!!! What was I
> thinking???? Just for example, my hunam cleric has *alot* of
> charisma and
> some added strength. Why? Well, when you are hauling all
> that loot back to
> the merchants to get those extra good prices from the high
> charisma....
> seemed like a good idea at the time when all you had to go on
> was what was
> printed in the *stoopid* EQ user manual. Their character
> creation sections
> (to this day) really do a bad job of helping people get started.
>
> Sylly
>
>
> Lyrnia wrote:
>
> > >FYI: I've known him, in game, since Beta 2. He's a
> > >nice guy, fun to hunt with and very knowledgeable
>
> Then another bard sang:
>
> > I mostly lurk here but I really feel that I do have to
> > comment here. Remember Gordon is the guy who felt
> > that putting points into strength for his necro was a
> > valid character creation strategy..
>
>
